fields.summary: Unable to see dimension information in Custom CloudWatch metrics

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description:
euca-vWhen running the following command (or something like it)
euwatch-put-data -m metric -n namespace -v 1.0 --dimensions key1=val1,key2=val2 -t 2015-10-13T00:00:00Z

No dimensions are passed in via the back end.  This is probably due to the following debug output from the command.
 
2015-10-13 22:20:46,817 DEBUG   PutMetricData parsed arguments: {'security_token': None, 'url': None, 'Namespace': 'namespace', 'MetricData.member.1.StatisticValues': None, 'Dimensions.member': [{'Name': 'key1', 'Value': 'val1'}, {'Name': 'key2', 'Value': 'val2'}], 'MetricData.member.1.Unit': None, 'MetricData.member.1.Value': 1.0, 'MetricData.member.1.Timestamp': '2015-10-13T00:00:00Z', 'show_empty_fields': False, 'MetricData.member.1.MetricName': 'metric', 'key_id': None, 'secret_key': None, 'region': None}


Note: Metric data contains dimensions so the Dimensions.member reference above should be something more like MetricData.member.1.Dimensions.member
fields.summary: euwatch-put-data does not send dimensions to CW

comments.body: That patch looks great to me.  Thanks!  This issue is fixed in commit {{f3a983c}} in the 3.3 series, and commit {{913baa0}} in the 3.2 series.

Verified.

{noformat}
